alert.note: Alert for Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 11:47AM EDT until May 01 at 11:41PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Swift River At Roxbury affecting Oxford County. For the Swift River...including Roxbury...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swift River at Roxbury. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins. At 9.0 feet, Flood waters inundate Route 17 in Byron near the intersection of Byron Village Road. At 10.0 feet, Closure of Route 17 likely from flood waters, significantly impacting travel in and out of the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Monday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EDT Monday was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this afternoon to 3.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then rise to 4.7 feet tomorrow evening. It will fall to 4.6 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then rise to 5.1 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
